stories.original_headline: The genetic advantage that helps some people stay sharp for life
stories.original_summary: A new study reveals that super agers over 80 have a distinct genetic edge. They are much less likely to carry the gene most associated with Alzheimer’s risk, even when compared with other healthy seniors. Researchers also found higher levels of a protective gene variant in this group. Together, the
stories.fantasy_headline: Ancient Bloodline's Secret: Some Elders Retain Sharp Minds to Their Last Breath!
stories.fantasy_story: Wise Wizards of the Eldrin College have uncovered a marvelous secret within the oldest noble bloodlines. Some elders possess a unique ancestral mark that wards off the creeping mists that cloud the mind in old age. This magical boon ensures they keep their wits keen and memories bright through many long years.

stories.original_headline: Why some people get bad colds and others don’t
stories.original_summary: Scientists found that nasal cells act as a first line of defense against the common cold, working together to block rhinovirus soon after infection. A fast antiviral response can stop the virus before symptoms appear. If that response is weakened or delayed, the virus spreads and causes inflammation
stories.fantasy_headline: Mysteries of Winter's Sniffles: Why Some Fall Ill, Others Stand Strong!
stories.fantasy_story: Healers of the Whispering Woods have discovered that tiny sentry sprites guard the inner gates of our breath. These vigilant spirits fight off the naughty imps of the coughing blight before they can take hold. When the sentries are swift and strong, one remains hale; but if they slumber, the blight spreads its chills.

stories.original_headline: Leak: Nvidia is about to challenge ‘Intel Inside’ with as many as eight Arm laptops
stories.original_summary: Intel and AMD have split the Windows laptop market for years, but the x86 players may be getting outnumbered. It's not just Apple MacBooks and MediaTek-based Chromebooks using Arm chips anymore. There are finally competent Qualcomm Snapdragon laptops running Windows, and - as soon as this spring - N
stories.fantasy_headline: The Great Scrolls War: New Makers Challenge Ancient Guilds!
stories.fantasy_story: For ages, the Intel and AMD Merchant Guilds have ruled the market for enchanted scrolls, but rivals stir. Whispers tell of the Nvidia Clan preparing many new portable scrying mirrors, powered by unique arcane crystals. These novel artifacts may soon challenge the ancient dominance of the old guilds.
